Additional Scope Comments: (A) Treasury components - separate Forms NA-1005: The following Treasury components (including bureaus and offices of Inspectors General) will submit separate Forms NA-1005 in anticipation of adopting the Capstone General Records Schedule (GRS 6.1) -- -- Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau (Record Group 564) -- Bureau of Engraving and Printing (RG 318) -- Bureau of the Fiscal Service (RG 425) -- Community Development Financial Institutions Fund (RG 056)  -- Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (RG 559) -- Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration (RG 056) -- Office of the Inspector General (RG 056) -- United States Mint (RG 104)(B) Other Treasury components: Please note the following -   -- Internal Revenue Service (RG 058) obtained a non-GRS records schedule (Standard Form 115) for email in October 2015 -- Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (RG 101) will obtain a non-GRS records schedule (SF 115) for email -- Office of the Special Inspector General for the Troubled Asset Relief Program (RG 056) is incorporated in this Form NA-1005(C) Other Departmental Offices: The Office of Foreign Assets Control within Departmental Offices will submit a separate Form NA-1005 under its separate records group (RG 265).(D) Administrative records for non-Capstone accounts: These records will be retained for seven years.
Cutoff Instructions: Email of Capstone officials (item 010) will be cut off at the end of the employee’s tenure.
Transfer Instructions: Email of Capstone officials (item 010) will be transferred to NARA either 15 years after cutoff or after declassification review (when applicable), whichever is later.
Legacy Email Scope: Departmental Offices will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to 2001.  Agency is still determining the full scope of our legacy email.  It dates back to sometime before 2001.  We will report our full finding to NARA within 6 months.
